titleStmt.title: The Levellers new remonstrance or declaration sent to His Excellencie the Lord General Fairfax, concerning their present proceedings, and making choice of a glorious King, and heavenly protector, for the redeeming of them from slavery, and judging the cause of the oppressed righteously. Also, their demands and proposals to the judges and ministers of this nation, touching the reign and government of the late King Charles; with a discovery of those persons who held their royalty by the power of the sword.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printen [sic] for generall satisfaction to all the free-born people of England,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
